title: Add a dedicated scaffold section for user custom code (frontend + backend)

requirements.text: Create a new frontend scaffold component file intended for user extensions, with clear TODO markers and a minimal placeholder UI, and export it for use elsewhere in the app.

quotes: make a new section in the code for me to code the rest in

acceptanceCriteria: A new TypeScript React component file exists in the frontend codebase dedicated to user custom code (e.g., a 'UserExtensions'/'CustomSection' component).
The file includes clear comment delimiters (e.g., 'BEGIN USER CODE' / 'END USER CODE') indicating where the user should add code.
The component renders without crashing and shows a simple placeholder (e.g., heading + short description) using existing Tailwind/shadcn styling patterns.

requirements.text: Add the new frontend scaffold component into an existing screen so it is visible in the running app (without disrupting existing control panel behavior).

quotes: make a new section in the code for me to code the rest in

acceptanceCriteria: The Control Panel UI renders the new scaffold section in a sensible location (e.g., in a sidebar panel or below existing panels) and remains fully functional in both Edit and Interact modes.
No existing control creation, layout editing, fullscreen, import/export, or recent signals behavior regresses.

requirements.text: Add a clearly labeled backend scaffold section in backend/main.mo for future user-defined logic, implemented as at least one harmless placeholder query or shared method returning a static value.

quotes: make a new section in the code for me to code the rest in

acceptanceCriteria: backend/main.mo contains a clearly marked section for user custom code (comment block with TODO markers).
At least one placeholder canister method exists in that section (query or shared) that compiles and returns a static value (e.g., Text) without affecting existing layout/event functionality.
Existing backend methods (getLayout/saveLayout/emitEvent/getRecentEvents/getEventsByControlId) continue to behave as before, including 4-bit binary validation.

constraints: Do not modify files under frontend/src/components/ui (shadcn) directly; only compose them.
Do not edit the immutable frontend hook/bootstrap paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT (e.g., frontend/src/main.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts).
Backend must remain a single Motoko actor in backend/main.mo; only add migration.mo if state schema changes require it.
nonGoals: Do not implement any new product functionality beyond providing a scaffold/extension area.
Do not redesign the existing control panel UI or change existing control behavior.
Do not add any third-party integrations, external databases, or additional backend services.
